page.title: 02The Shropshire Union Canal
page.content: The canal which we surveyed was the Montgomeryshire branch of the Shropshire Union canal.. The canal is now disused and this is probably due to the coming of the railway. The canal is now dry and reeds cover the muddy bottom. The only place where water lies is a place called Devil's Hole. Legend says that anyone who falls in is pulled under by the devil. The stretch of canal we studied was roughly three miles long and had three bridges crossing it. The bridges were made of stone, but over the years they have been repaired with modern day bricks. Most of the bridges are of the same design, they are mostly hump-back bridges.
